title: How correct is using the expression ''of course'' in an academic essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Of course” can be used in many ways; sarcastically, as an exclamation, as a superlative or exaggeration. I wouldn’t use it this way in an academic context. However, generally speaking, I see no problem using it to observe an obvious conclusion. Of course*, you also have to consider for whom you are writing, and does that person, group, or publication have an opinion on the matter. Academics can get quite wound up over such things. *I would consider that a fair example of using the expression in a loosely academic context. I see writing as a balance between clarity and creativity. Academic writing will demand clarity, but that doesn’t mean creative choices are nonexistent. While I might often chose different ways to express this logic, I certainly would not preclude “of course” just because of the academic style.
